image.altText: Profile of a man,

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Greg Lynn's Victorian High Country murder trial are preparing for a second trial after the Court of Appeal quashed his conviction.

title.children: Greg Lynn's appeal was succesful. What happens now?

image.altText: A large, old building in central Bendigo in Victoria

props.synopsis: Council officers recommend a one-year hiatus for the Bendigo Writers Festival to work on repairing the reputation of the event.

title.children: Bendigo Writers Festival in damage control, report recommends one-year break

image.altText: The front of a house in a street in Brookfield.

props.synopsis: A family who lived in a Melbourne home where police uncovered human remains while investigating the disappearance of a toddler say they are disturbed by the find.

title.children: Family who lived at home where human remains found 'trashed' house, sources say

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, the son of Carlton Football Club great Stephen Silvagni, can now be identified as the man last week found guilty of raping a woman in 2024, after a court lifted a restriction on publishing his name.

title.children: Tom Silvagni named as man from high-profile family convicted of rape

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: The Victorian government calls for tenders after it approved exploration licenses for two new gas projects in the Otway and Gippsland basins.

title.children: Victoria green-lights new gas exploration in Gippsland and the Otways

image.altText: A graphic showing the BOM website.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has updated the rain radar, temperature information and warning displays on its new website in response to public feedback.

title.children: BOM website receives first major update since launch

image.altText: Chloe Fell wears a high vis plumbing polo shirt on a building site and is smiling

props.synopsis: The nail-biting wait is over for tens of thousands of Victorian year 12 students, who will begin receiving their much-anticipated VCE results online from 7am today.

title.children: Thousands of VCE students to receive ATAR as results released

image.altText: A wide brown river and farms

props.synopsis: Jindalee Road Wines and its former manager have been penalised $558,000 for illegally tapping into an irrigation pipeline and stealing water.

title.children: Water thieves forced to pay $558,000

image.altText: Metallic letters spelling Mildura Law Courts on the facade of a light-coloured building.

props.synopsis: Mildura man Jordan Stewart Blair has been found guilty of sexually assaulting a woman less than a day after he viciously bashed her in May, 2024.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping woman 16 hours after brutally beating her

image.altText: Susan Kennedy with a sign outside the front of her Ramsay Street home saying 'fight the freeway'

props.synopsis: After more than 40 years on air, the final credits will roll on the iconic soap Neighbours — again.

title.children: 'Bring it home in a blaze of glory': Neighbours wraps up, again

image.altText: Stacey Warnecke smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

title.children: Melbourne influencer died from haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears

image.altText: A woman with red hair is smiling while making a coffee. She is wearing grand prix memorabilia.

props.synopsis: The MotoGP has been held on Victoria's Phillip Island for almost 30 years, but the community fears it could be lost when its contract expires next year.

title.children: Phillip Island's MotoGP contract expires next year and locals are campaigning to keep on track

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Detectives have discovered what appear to be human remains while investigating the disappearance of a Melbourne toddler 11 years ago.

title.children: Remains found during investigation into toddler's disappearance

image.altText: A female wheelchair user is on a path, back to the camera, next to the beach and a tree

props.synopsis: From bushfires and decreasing air quality to flooding and erosion, climate change is threatening our relationship with nature, and people with disability are being disproportionately impacted.

title.children: Climate crisis threatens disabled Australians' access to nature

image.altText: An entrance to a building

props.synopsis: The former staffer of a school for children with disabilities vigorously denies child sex abuse allegations, a court has heard.

title.children: Melbourne woman ‘vigorously opposes’ child sex charges

image.altText: A young boy looks at the camera sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Supreme Court judge says the destruction of 19-year-old Charlie Gander's body after his murder has added to the impact on his family.

title.children: Judge says burning of murder victim's body was a 'horrible thing to do'

image.altText: Lara standing in her garden behind her house, among thriving and flowering plants.

props.synopsis: Residents of a former migrant hostel have won the right to keep living in their homes, years after they were first threatened with eviction because of a zoning issue.

title.children: Dozens of residents win right to remain in Melbourne housing estate

image.altText: A photo of Dau Akueng from the order of service

props.synopsis: A teen charged with the stabbing murder of a 15-year-old boy in Melbourne's west will remain in youth custody.

title.children: Melbourne teenager accused of killing Dau Akueng denied bail

image.altText: A police car and police tape on a busy street.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives have charged a 16-year-old boy with murder three days after a 40-year-old man was found with stab wounds in Melbourne's north.

title.children: Police charge teenager wanted over fatal Melbourne stabbing

image.altText: A smoking ceremony on the steps of Victorian Parliament

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has made a historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians, in one of the first public acts to follow the signing of the state's treaty agreement.

title.children: Victorian government makes historic apology to Aboriginal people

image.altText: A silhouette of a man and a woman arguing

props.synopsis: Financial and domestic abuse survivors say the way Centrelink assesses benefit payments for people in a relationship makes it harder for women to leave dangerous relationships.

title.children: Abuse survivors say Centrelink's 'couple rule' puts women in danger

image.altText: A man, woman and two children posing for a photo

props.synopsis: Families living at Falls Creek in Victoria's Alpine region want Alpine Resorts Victoria to reconsider its decision to close the mountain's only childcare facility.

title.children: Alpine resort's only childcare service set to shut its doors next year

image.altText: A young girl wearing a black hooded jumper standing on a green surface in front of an outdoor pool

props.synopsis: Kids in regional Victoria say the social media ban will 'cut off' contact with friends and family leading to further isolation.

title.children: Regional kids say social media ban will make isolation worse

image.altText: Drone shot looking straight down at a wind turbine and its shadow across a green field

props.synopsis: Soaring costs and trenchant criticism from some put the brakes on wind and transmission as the sun shines on big solar and batteries.

title.children: Energy blueprint shake-up as 'market moves faster than the systems plan'

image.altText: The exterior of a house with a metal roof and metal fence

props.synopsis: The prosecution has begun its closing arguments in the final stages of Jodie Hill's three week murder trial following the brutal killing of an elderly man in his Dimboola home almost three years ago.

title.children: Prosecution tells jury accused lied when denying involvement in alleged murder

image.altText: Two men hold a small ball each.

props.synopsis: Karen and Karenni refugees in central Victoria are taking a traditional sport to the world championships and staying connected in the process.

title.children: Refugees keep sport of sepak takraw alive and kicking in Bendigo

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: Two women, aged 84 and 64, were found dead in a home in Rosanna following a welfare check on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Police investigating deaths of two women in Melbourne's north-east

image.altText: Man with white skin and blue shirt stands on rural property in front of water tank.

props.synopsis: Fuels produced from waste and agricultural feedstock are tipped to play a role in cutting emissions, but a leading Victorian farmer says political will is required to seize the opportunity.

title.children: Farmers say Australia needs government will to unlock biofuel potential

image.altText: Nikkita Azzopardi, pictured smiling at a party.

props.synopsis: The family of a Melbourne woman who was brutally killed by her partner say they're distraught after the man was found not guilty due to mental impairment.

title.children: Man found not guilty of Melbourne woman's murder due to mental impairment

image.altText: A young boy in a baseball cap and black jumper smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The mother of murdered Victorian man Charlie Gander has told the Victorian Supreme court that he was an amazing son and brother.

title.children: Charlie Gander's mother tells court of the moment she learnt of his murder

image.altText: A man with scruffy hair and beard posses with a Fellowship of the Ring movie poster.

props.synopsis: Peter Jackson's life wouldn't be the same after that red carpet event on December 10, 2001, but it's fair to say cinema, and New Zealand, wouldn't be the same either.

title.children: How Peter Jackson fought for his Middle Earth dream, armed with a VHS tape

image.altText: A toy car on fire

props.synopsis: Fire services are urging people to buy lithium-ion battery products from reputable suppliers ahead of Christmas after yet another house fire was suspected to have been caused by a lithium battery on the weekend.

title.children: Another house fire likely sparked by lithium battery as firies reissue safety warnings

image.altText: A carer pushes Connie. Both are smiling.

props.synopsis: Parents of some of Victoria's most vulnerable people fear what will happen to their loved ones if hundreds of group homes are forced to close.

title.children: Families 'devastated' amid fears of Victorian group home closures

image.altText: An aerial shot of the scene of a collision between a vehicle and a building in Melbourne's north-west.

props.synopsis: A male pedestrian has been killed and a woman seriously injured after a car crashed into a medical centre in Melbourne's north-west, travelling for 30 metres before it came to a halt.

title.children: Pedestrian killed as car crashes into Melbourne medical centre

image.altText: A woman at a computer with a transgender flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police fought a legal battle with a transgender woman for more than two years before admitting it incorrectly referred her to men's support services.

title.children: Trans woman took on police and won after being referred to men's help service
